job_title: Shop Assistant in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Choose your hours, maintain the shop, and work on your own stuff for the rest of the time.
cons: Pay is minimum wage, at the time $15/hour

review_title: low pay, health benefits are getting worse
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The location is convenient. It has basic health benefits, matched retirement contributions. Some students and staff are friendly and interesting people.
cons: Some key managers/admin are underqualified, temperamental. Allowed vacation times are limited. Pay is low for the field and is not inflation adjusted. The social hierarchy is oppressive at times. You may need to supplement income to afford Los Angeles rent.

job_title: Student Photographer in Los Angeles, CA
pros: good work balance, flexible time arrangement
cons: minimum hourly pay by the state

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The school was very considerate of pays.
cons: no cons really. I had a great time working at SCI-Arc.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Good Work Study Position for students
cons: Minimum wage for student work study

job_title: Peer Mentor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: one the of best architecture school in the world
cons: a bit of a small school to work at

job_title: Story Producer in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Very experimental and dynamic environment. Great people and great learning experience
cons: Cannot think of any downsides to the work. It was always very interesting

pros: Interesting school and students. It's a very unique place with some nice employees who are attracted to the idea of a unique place...but are probably going to leave soon.
cons: This place is unprofessional all around. Higher ups  don't care about staff at all and will show it in every way. It's very low pay, they over work staff without acknowledging your work by money or even any respect. It's disorganized, there is staff drama in every department, and the HR lady is absolutely horrible and doesn't even do a good job of hiding it.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: There is always work to do so dont expect downtime when working. Other than that, know your topic and you'll undoubtedly build relationships with either students or teachers. Networking with those in your industry or those soon to be is also not a bad thing.
cons: "your mileage may vary" is very true here. Working for one instructor can mean completely different amount of work. There are "easy" TA positions that demand only 1-2 hours a wk; there are also TA positions that demand 6-8 hours a wk.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Inspiring student energy, intriguing educational programs, some good colleagues, great location in downtown LA. The school is going through a transformation with new leadership so it could be different now.
cons: Hierarchical, hostile, out-of-touch upper administration - it seems to be an okay place to work if you're an architect, but if you're just a staff member, you are a second-class citizen.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Wide range of challenging tasks. Surrounded by great minds. Very interesting environment and amazing facilities. A great platform to speculate and share ideas.
cons: Very little payment. Stagnating promotion options within the company. No insurance as part time employee. No extra benefits or compensations.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Los Angeles, CA
pros: A great chance to meet new people, including students from other programs and other school faculties. A great chance to get extra opportunities from your experienced teachers.
cons: Underpaid. It's not even going to cover your breakfasts.

job_title: Assistant Teacher in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Good communication and interaction with faculty members. If wanted, frequent interaction with other students and events. Facility perks similar to students (Workshop, Computers, etc.)
cons: Involvement must be actively sought. Times can change on short notice.  Overtime needed dependent on specific projects. At-will employment

job_title: Studio Instructor in Los Angeles, CA
cons: Extremely stressful, too much design fetichism
